name: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport - Burlingame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this was a great hotel and it met our needs perfectly. We wanted a night near the airport after a long flight from the UK. I decided to use some Hyatt points for a 2 night stay in a Club room. The shuttle arrived at the SFO Internation terminal very quickly - there is also a phone to call them at the pick up area if you need it.
reviews.title: Used my Hyatt points and wasn't disappointed

reviews.text: A quick 5-10 min journey (first stopping at the Marriott) and we were there. We were met by a very cheerful and welcoming receptionist who checked us in quickly - the luggage was dealt with and sent to our room on the top floor (9? can't remember)
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The room overlooked the atrium and had a large king bed, nice desk and chair, large flat TV, sofa/footstall and a decent sized clean bathroom. I thought at first that it might be noisy but in fact we didn't hear anyone either from the atrium or the corridor outside. It was dark but with the lights on was actually really cosy and pleasant. The bed was VERY comfortable.
reviews.title: There are better options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lounge was a nice facility - a couple of PCs to use, honour bar and an outside patio area where we watched our BA 747 start its return back to the UK. Very interesting to see the planes landing parallel to each other too! Food in the club room was OK - nothing fantastic but then I never expect it to be of enormous quality. I can recommend the cheese and biscuits with a glass of red wine - a lovely way to relax.
reviews.title: Bring your walking shoes

reviews.text: The next day we caught the shuttle back to the airport and then the BART into the city - this was super quick and easy - cheap too at $16 return each. Did all the touristy things but as we've been to SF before, this wasn't the main point of our visit.
reviews.title: Convenient for business trip
This is a great hotel
reviews.text: We were just passing through San Francisco and needed a hotel at the airport. We got lucky enough to win our stay on Priceline. We were delighted with the accommodations. The room was full of all the nicest linens, towels and furnishings. We ate at the restaurant in the atrium and it was very pleasant and relaxing. Our food was tasty and service was very attentive. The airport shuttle was on time and worked like a charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this Hyatt property,to sum it up in one word "Outstanding". You can't go wrong staying here,comfortable rooms,helpful staff,close to everything ,free airport shuttle and a Sunday brunch to die for !! We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel,outstanding staff

reviews.text: The hotel has 8 floors and is about a block big. It only has elevators on one corner of the hotel. The rooms have no microwave, but there is a microwave that can be used in the ground floor.
reviews.title: Not baby friendly

reviews.text: We were assigned a room on the 8th floor in the corner opposite to the elevator, we where the only ones in the whole hotel that requested a crib, so they assigned the furthest room from the entrance and microwave to the only family in the hotel, which had of course asked for the microwave.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Great Stay

reviews.text: It was oracle open world week, so we didn't complain, since we assumed that the hotel was packed (which wasn't since our friends arrived the next day, and obviously had better rooms). But let's forget about that.
reviews.title: Great place to get sleep while you're near the airport

reviews.text: I was flying from SFO to Mumbai on British Airways and our flight to London got cancelled at the last minute due to a technical problem. As usual chaos ensued. I was in business class so has a lower wait to get to the checkin in counter. They put all of us up at this hotel. We got the room at $80 in meal voucher, no booz included :(.
reviews.title: Forced Stay

reviews.text: The hotel was providing shuttle from the airport. There was 100 people wanting to board the shuttle but it had a luggage carrying capacity for maximum, 5-7 people. I would assume that the hotel would know better that as it was a cancelled flight everyone wanted to get to the hotel and they would run more shuttles.
reviews.title: Four Good Things - Two Very Bad Things!

reviews.text: After waiting for almost 20 minutes with little movement I just hopped into a cab with my 3 bags. The hotel is less than 10 minutes away. Cab fare is about $12-15. Got into the hotel and as the latest round of the shuttle had not arrived check in was a breeze. They gave me a room with 2 queens, kings were not available.
reviews.title: Best service ever!

reviews.text: I had the option of splitting the $80 in different vouchers which could used against food. 80 bucks of food in 1 night!!!! That just was not going to happen. I went to the bar and ordered some food. It was strictly OK.
reviews.title: Conferences make it crowded

reviews.text: Room was average, nothing great but nothing bad. It faced the interstate so I was concerned that the traffic noise would keep me up. But fortunately that was not the case. The windows are properly sound proofed.
reviews.title: "airport" location is a misnomer as the...

reviews.text: the hotel itself is huge
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the gym and rooms were great
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: the beds we amazing
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, would return again!

reviews.text: overall great stay
reviews.title: It is a nice hotel closer to the Airport however, small problem that they hidden charge me one of incidental during stay

reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay over the Labor Day weekend. Hotel is nice with a very large atrium. Our room was a suite and thus had lots of room and a nice view of the Bay.
reviews.title: Reliable, good rooms, not so good food

aka: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport - Burlingame Hotel Burlingame
description: Dramatic atrium, 9 story hotel with cascading waterfalls and water channels amidst a park-like atmosphere, lush foliage, including over 2,000 flowers, plants and bamboo plants.
